result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice D. Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maurice D. Sanders is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maurice D. Sanders was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice D. Sanders not in court.  Nick Perry DeSiato appeared for the City of Milwaukee.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case in court for return of property.  City of Milwaukee does not object to the return of property.  Court takes no action until the petitioner appears.
Return of property hearing on October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
CANCELLATION OF HUBER / WORK RELEASE / ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE PRIVILEGES PURSUANT TO WISCONSIN STATUTES SECTION 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge PROTASIEWICZ, Br 24, for review.  jm

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time, with credit for 5 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS. 

Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction condition time, with Huber release for work and treatment. Defendant to report for sentence on 9/4/2015 at 5:00pm.

Probation Conditions: 
-AODA assessment, comply with any recommended treatment. 
-Absolute Sobriety, to include random drug screens.
-30 hours of community service.
-Parenting Classes. 
-Maintain full time employment.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges; including DNA surcharge, during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Filed, 
Sentencing Referral Form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties believe plea was started on last court date, but not completed. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.

Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JUDGE BOROWSKI, BRANCH 12 FOR JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  The defendant appears without counsel.  He advised the clerk that he is no longer and may qualify for Public Defender representation.  The defendant was referred to the Public Defender's office. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defedant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Maurice D. Sanders in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  

IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  
Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch *  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
